gtsoft.ivory.server.jca.spi
Class IvoryConnectionManager4nme

java.lang.Object
  gtsoft.ivory.server.jca.spi.IvoryConnectionManager4nme
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, javax.resource.spi.ConnectionManager
public class IvoryConnectionManager4nme
extends java.lang.Object
implements javax.resource.spi.ConnectionManager

This class is only used in a non-managed environment, when the Ivory resource adapter is not running under the control of a J2EE application server. Use this class to manually allocate a Connection object instead of using InitialContext.lookup.getConnection()

In this case an ivory.properties file is required to be accessible on the classpath for Ivory to function properly.

See Also:

Method Detail

allocateConnection

public java.lang.Object allocateConnection(javax.resource.spi.ManagedConnectionFactory inMcf,
                                           javax.resource.spi.ConnectionRequestInfo cri)
                                    throws javax.resource.ResourceException
Allocate a Connection object to be used to execute an Interaction with Ivory. Both parameters may be null. This method should only be used in a non-managed environment. A non-managed environment is one where a J2EE application server is not managing the Ivory related connections. In this case an ivory.properties file is required to be accessible on the classpath for Ivory to function properly.

Specified by:
allocateConnection in interface javax.resource.spi.ConnectionManager
Parameters:
inMcf - ManagedConnectionFactory, null is acceptable
cri - ConnectionRequestInfo, null is acceptable
Returns:
a Connection object which can then be used to interact with Ivory
Throws:
javax.resource.ResourceException

getManagedConnectionFactory

public javax.resource.spi.ManagedConnectionFactory getManagedConnectionFactory()
Returns the ManagedConnectionFactory object

Returns:
a ManagedConnectionFactory object which can then be used as the first parameter for the allocateConnection method.
